newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian bonds becalmed, focus on equities.
newsitem.headline: Belgian bonds becalmed, focus on equities.

text.p: Belgian linear bonds were a touch higher in very quiet dealings on Friday, with most attention riveted on the equities market where a major reshuffle in the financial sector was underway, traders said.
"It is pretty quiet. There is not a lot going on. Most people are more interested in their equities portfolios," one trader said.
"We had a bit of a scare on Bavarian inflation figures that caused a little dip, but it didn't last," the trader added.
Traders said short-term interest rates were stable and there was little change in the Belgian franc's position.
Traders said that after a week in which linear bonds had lost a lot of ground, the future would now be heavily influenced by the movement of the Japanese yen.
They said there was little real activity on the bond market on Friday, although there had been some business in 10-year paper.
The yield of the benchmark 2007 OLO was 5.98 percent at 1010 GMT against Thursday's closing 5.99 percent, and the spread over German Bunds was an unchanged seven basis points.
The June futures contract was seven basis points higher at 120.64. -- Brussels Newsroom +32 2 287 6810, Fax +32 2 230 7710
